data.proposal:
# 7-Day Vacation Itinerary for Madrid


## Overview
Begin with a brief overview of what makes this trip special. The total budget is approximately $2000. This plan is for Solo traveler(s). The travelers are interested in: Sightseeing, Shopping, Dining, South Street Seaport, The Sphere.


## Day 1

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Include SPECIFIC breakfast location recommendations with actual restaurant names
  - Café Central (Plaza del Sol, 28014 Madrid) for a traditional Spanish breakfast
  - Chocolatería San Ginés (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9, 28005 Madrid) for a sweet and savory treat
- List SPECIFIC attractions, sites or activities (include actual names, not generic descriptions)
  - Visit the Royal Palace of Madrid (Plaza de la Villa, s/n, 28006 Madrid), an impressive palace that serves as the official residence of the Spanish royal family
  - Explore the Prado Museum (Calle de Felipe IV, s/n, 28014 Madrid), one of the world's greatest art museums
- Include estimated duration for each activity and travel time between locations
  - 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Visit Royal Palace of Madrid (1.5 hours)
  - 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Travel to Prado Museum (45 minutes) + 30 minutes to explore the museum


### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Recommend SPECIFIC lunch spots with actual restaurant names
  - Botín (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 10, 28005 Madrid), a historic restaurant serving traditional Spanish cuisine
  - El Qu Jetcho (Plaza de la Villa, s/n, 28006 Madrid), a cozy eatery offering modern Spanish dishes
- List SPECIFIC afternoon activities with actual location names
  - Visit the Plaza Mayor (Plaza Mayor, 28012 Madrid), a historic square in the heart of the city
  - Explore the Mercado de San Miguel (Calle de los Cuchilleros, s/n, 28005 Madrid), a beautiful and lively market selling fresh food, wine, and local products
- Include estimated duration and any entrance fees or special notes
  - 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Lunch at Botín (1.5 hours)
  - 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Visit Plaza Mayor (1 hour) + 45 minutes to explore Mercado de San Miguel


### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Recommend SPECIFIC dinner restaurants with actual names
  - La Tasquita de Enfrente (Calle de la Victoria, 2, 28012 Madrid), a cozy restaurant serving traditional Spanish cuisine
  - El Prior (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 8, 28005 Madrid), an elegant eatery offering modern Spanish dishes
- Include SPECIFIC evening activities or entertainment options
  - Enjoy a Flamenco show at Cardamomo Flamenco Tablao (Calle de la Victoria, s/n, 28012 Madrid)
  - Stroll through the beautiful Retiro Park (Paseo del Prado, s/n, 28001 Madrid) and enjoy the city's nightlife


## Day 2

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Include SPECIFIC breakfast location recommendations with actual restaurant names
  - Café Gijón (Calle de San Nicolas, 10, 28005 Madrid), a charming café serving traditional Spanish breakfast
  - Chocolatería San Ginés (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9, 28005 Madrid) for a sweet and savory treat
- List SPECIFIC attractions, sites or activities (include actual names, not generic descriptions)
  - Visit the Reina Sofia Museum (Calle de Santa Isabel, s/n, 28012 Madrid), one of the world's greatest art museums
  - Explore the historic center of Madrid, including the Cathedral of Madrid and the Royal Chapel
- Include estimated duration for each activity and travel time between locations
  - 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Visit Reina Sofia Museum (1.5 hours)
  - 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Travel to historic center + 30 minutes to explore


### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Recommend SPECIFIC lunch spots with actual restaurant names
  - Botín (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 10, 28005 Madrid), a historic restaurant serving traditional Spanish cuisine
  - El Qu Jetcho (Plaza de la Villa, s/n, 28006 Madrid), a cozy eatery offering modern Spanish dishes
- List SPECIFIC afternoon activities with actual location names
  - Visit the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum (Paseo del Prado, 8, 28014 Madrid), one of the world's greatest art museums
  - Explore the lively Malasaña neighborhood, known for its street art, boutiques, and nightlife
- Include estimated duration and any entrance fees or special notes
  - 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Lunch at Botín (1.5 hours)
  - 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Visit Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum (1 hour) + 45 minutes to explore Malasaña


### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Recommend SPECIFIC dinner restaurants with actual names
  - La Tasquita de Enfrente (Calle de la Victoria, 2, 28012 Madrid), a cozy restaurant serving traditional Spanish cuisine
  - El Prior (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 8, 28005 Madrid), an elegant eatery offering modern Spanish dishes
- Include SPECIFIC evening activities or entertainment options
  - Enjoy a Flamenco show at Cardamomo Flamenco Tablao (Calle de la Victoria, s/n, 28012 Madrid)
  - Stroll through the beautiful Retiro Park (Paseo del Prado, s/n, 28001 Madrid) and enjoy the city's nightlife


## Day 3

  - Chocolatería San Ginés (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9, 28005 Madrid) for a sweet and savory treat
- List SPECIFIC attractions, sites or activities (include actual names, not generic descriptions)
  - Visit the Segovia Aqueduct (Calzada Real, s/n, 43400 Segovia), an ancient Roman aqueduct and UNESCO World Heritage Site
  - Explore the historic city of Toledo, a UNESCO World Heritage Site ( approx. 1 hour from Madrid by train)
- Include estimated duration for each activity and travel time between locations
  - 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Visit Segovia Aqueduct (1.5 hours)
  - 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM: Travel to Toledo + 30 minutes to explore


### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)

  - El Qu Jetcho (Plaza de la Villa, s/n, 28006 Madrid), a cozy eatery offering modern Spanish dishes
- List SPECIFIC afternoon activities with actual location names
  - Visit the Toledo Cathedral (Calle del Cardenal Tavera, 1, 14001 Toledo) and the Alcázar of Toledo
  - Explore the narrow streets and historic buildings of the Jewish Quarter in Toledo
- Include estimated duration and any entrance fees or special notes
  - 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Lunch at Botín (1.5 hours)
  - 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM: Visit Toledo Cathedral + Alcázar of Toledo (1 hour) + 45 minutes to explore Jewish Quarter
